title: Man holding a banner
description: Photographer's description: Pictures taken during the Egyptian Revolution. Text in image: أنا مصرى حر مهما تفتح سجون و تعمل طوارئ بينى و بينك شوارع و عشق ربانى أصارع الموت ما بين المفارق و الروح ف ايد الخالق لو كنت طاهر بحق و عادل ما بين الخلايق ماكانش صف الحرس قتل الشباب ف الشوارع و ما دمت قادر تشوف الدم افتح طريق المقابر دا جنس مصرى عنيد ف الظلم يعمل مجازر أنا مصرى حر  Translation of Text in image: I am a free Egyptian no matter how many prisons you open or emergency laws you initiate, between us are streets and divine love, I fight death between the junctions and the soul is in the hands of the creator, If you were really true and fair between god’s creations, then the line of policemen would not have killed the young martyrs in the streets, as long as you can see the blood open the road to the graveyards, this is a stubborn Egyptian species that starts massacres under injustice, I am a free Egyptian.
subject-lcsh: Demonstrations; Egypt; Political violence; Protest movements; Revolutions; Victims of state-sponsored terrorism
collection: University on the Square: Documenting Egypt's 21st Century Revolution
